Spoofing.cwe_description: Improper Authentication. The system does not correctly verify the identity of a user or component.

tids.tid_description: Remote service accessible without proper authentication.
Use of hard-coded credentials enabling identity spoofing.

Tampering.cwe_description: Improper Control of Hardware Security Features. Hardware fault injection can alter execution flow.

tids.tid_description: Voltage or clock glitching to bypass security checks.

Tampering.cwe_description: Protection Mechanism Failure. Security controls are missing or ineffective.

tids.tid_description: Bootloader modification due to missing integrity protection.

Information Disclosure.cwe_description: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data. Data is stored or transmitted in clear text.

tids.tid_description: Data bus interception revealing sensitive information.
Extraction of secrets from ROM or NVRAM.

Information Disclosure.cwe_description: Improper Protection of Physical Side Channels.

tids.tid_description: Power consumption analysis to extract cryptographic secrets.

Denial of Service.cwe_description: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption leading to service unavailability.

tids.tid_description: Flooding requests causing ECU resource exhaustion.

Elevation of Privilege.cwe_description: On-Chip Debug and Test Interface With Improper Access Control.

tids.tid_description: Unauthorized access via JTAG or SWD interface.
Latent debug port enabling memory or code manipulation.
